description: This Spicy Steak Chili is a hearty and flavorful dish that brings warmth and excitement to any meal. Packed with tender steak, beans, and a kick of spice, it's perfect for gatherings or cozy nights in.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add the cubed steak and brown on all sides.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Add the beef broth and diced tomatoes, bringing the mixture to a simmer.
Stir in the beans and let the chili cook for at least one hour, stirring occasionally.
tips: For a richer flavor, let the chili simmer longer and consider adding a splash of hot sauce for extra heat.

structured_content.content: This Spicy Steak Chili is not just a meal; it's an experience. The combination of tender steak, hearty beans, and a medley of spices creates a dish that warms the soul. Perfect for game days or family gatherings, this chili is sure to impress.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this chili for a game day gathering. The aroma filled the house, and everyone couldn't wait to dig in. It became a staple for our family events, bringing everyone together over hearty bowls of warmth.

• Main ingredient: Use a good quality steak for the best flavor and tenderness; cube it into bite-sized pieces.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Chili powder and cumin are essential for that authentic chili taste; look for fresh spices for maximum flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Beans add texture and heartiness, while diced tomatoes provide a rich base.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot or Dutch oven is essential for even cooking and flavor development.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by chopping the onion and cubing the steak. Gather all spices and ingredients before cooking.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the steps to sauté, brown, and simmer, ensuring to stir occasionally for even cooking.
Finishing Touches:
Serve hot with toppings like cheese, sour cream, or fresh cilantro for added flavor.

upload.context: Capturing the cooking process of Spicy Steak Chili, highlighting the bubbling pot and rich colors.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the chili low and slow for the best flavor development.
  • Avoid overcooking the steak to keep it tender.
  • Look for a thickened sauce as a sign that the chili is ready.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 3 days and reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This chili is more than just food; it's a way to bring people together. Sharing bowls of this spicy delight with friends and family creates lasting memories and warmth.
Consider adding jalapeños for extra heat, or a splash of beer for depth. Fresh herbs like cilantro can brighten the flavors.
Pair with cornbread, tortilla chips, or a fresh salad. A cold beer or a glass of red wine complements the spice beautifully.
For a lighter version, substitute turkey for steak. You can also make it vegetarian by using lentils and vegetable broth.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Brown the steak in batches to avoid steaming.
  • Let the chili sit for a while before serving to enhance the flavors.
  • Use a meat thermometer to ensure steak is cooked perfectly.
  • Garnish with fresh ingredients for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try this Spicy Steak Chili; it's a dish that promises satisfaction and joy in every bite. Enjoy the process and the delicious results!
